summary: Penny will drive Sheldon to get Leonard a present before the party. She will wrap up an order of mee krob and a couple of lottery scratchers.
Leonard and Penny are sleeping. Sheldon is eating cereal and watching Doctor Who on BBC America on the couch. He wakes up at 6 am and eats cereal.
Penny is new in town and she's looking for Howard. Penny and Sheldon are surprised that Howard is not at the meeting with her. Howard doesn't know her.
Raj, Leonard, Howard and Sheldon need a social catalyst. They can't get 15-year-old girls drunk. Sheldon is a Jew and would wail at the Wailing Wall in Jerusalem.
Lalita came tonight to get her parents off her case. Lalita is not Howard's lady. Raj and Lalita's parents said they are 100% hooked up.

Leonard and Howard are fans of the musical Fiddler on the Roof. Sheldon and Leonard are not big fans of musicals, but they both love the premise of the show. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard agree that the story of Fiddler is universal.
Leonard Hofstadter is an egotist who needs to get his self-esteem from strangers to feel good about himself. Sheldon thinks he's smarter than everyone else in the room.
Leonard doesn't smell gas, but he doesn't believe his doctors. Howard thinks he might have smelled it, but it's not gas.
Toby and Sheldon discuss addiction and genetic predisposition towards addiction. There have been studies, but there are no double-blind studies, so there is no control group.

Penny, we'd love to help you, but Raj is going through some stuff right now. And besides, he doesn't drink, so... (WHISPERING INDISTINCTLY) Really? Um... Raj is going through some stuff right now and he'd like to take up drinking.
Leonard and Penny are at a party. Sheldon is a zebra and Kurt is an elf. Sheldon's costume is a scathing indictment of the American education system.
Leonard wants to make plans for New Year's with Leslie. The blogosphere is abuzz with news of him and Leslie making the bang, bang music.
Raj found Penny's boyfriend's iPod. He posted intimate details of their physical relationship on his blog. Raj will sell it on eBay as slightly used.
Leonard and Howard don't want Blossom from TV's Blossom to join their Physics Bowl team. Raj wants to ask Leslie Winkle from The Wonder Years.
Leonard doesn't want to read Penny's sex life. Penny feels betrayed and embarrassed and wants to crawl into a hole and die. Everyone else has already read it.

Leslie and Leonard have seen each other's faces during sexual intercourse. They don't feel uncomfortable about it. Leonard's preferences and performance are protected by the inherent rights of the relationship.

Leonard's sister is an attractive woman. She has the symmetry and low body fat that Western culture deems desirable. It's noteworthy that at other points in history heavier women were the standard for beauty because girth suggested affluence.
Leonard took Penny on a date with guys who didn't show up because of work and a colonoscopy, but it was just him, Penny and her.
Sheldon. In the living room. I just... I wanted you to know I saw the tie. Message received. You're welcome. You carry on. Give my best to Leslie.
Sheldon has an idea for a bulk, mail-order feminine hygiene company with glow-in-the-dark tampons. Sheldon and Leonard will be rich.
Leonard is not well suited for three-dimensional chess, so Sheldon suggests that he should try Candy Land instead. Sheldon and Leonard are playing Candy Land now.
Leonard and Penny are going to a symposium on molecular positronium on Friday at 8 pm. Sheldon will join them a week from Tuesday at 6.
Leonard is coming to a Thai restaurant. Howard wants him to make sure he doesn't eat peanuts. Every Thai restaurant in town knows you can't eat them.
Leonard wants Lesley to define the parameters of the kiss. Lesley wants it to be spontaneous, closed mouth, but romantic and with a Mint kiss.
Leonard's cousin Leo is Sheldon's cousin. Leo is 26 years old and originally from Denton, Texas. Leo was a Navy brat. Sheldon does not have a cousin Leo.
Leonard and Sheldon are going to collaborate on a project together. Sheldon is going to focus on his research instead of working on Dennis Kim's research.
Leonard and Sheldon are going to go on a date. Sheldon is thinking of Schrödinger's cat as a response to Leonard's question about the date.
Penny is still getting over her break-up with Kurt. She would like to have rebound sex with Doug. Leonard is not fond of the idea.
Leonard, Howard and Raj discuss Star Trek and Spock. Leonard explains that Spock's mother was human and his father was Vulcan, but they couldn't conceive, so they went to a clinic.
Sheldon went to the market with Penny three weeks ago. Penny is going to get crabby in the next four to eight days. Sheldon doesn't need someone telling on him to his mother.
Sheldon, Howard and Penny are running a B & B. Christy will stay with Howard, Penny will go back to her apartment and Leonard will watch the last 24 minutes of Doctor Who.
Leonard is going to put the pants on. He will be back in a moment. Penny will not look. Leonard and Sheldon are not going to compromise on the presentation.
Leonard wants to ask her out, but Sheldon doesn't want to as they're getting a cat and they're going to get a cat too.
Christy let Howard into Penny's apartment. Leonard and Penny will play one-on-one with Howard until he gets back. Sheldon and Leonard don't play teams.
Leonard and Lesley are going to finish the section first and then start the next one. They will play some music together as a musical foreplay.
Lesley proposed the experiment. There was a good kiss, reasonable technique and no extraneous spittle. On the other hand, there was no arousal. Lesley will present her findings first.
Raj's medication is wearing off and he's feeling unwell. Penny sends him a message about it to his wife, Raj's wife, Penny.

Gablehouser, Howard and Leonard are at a meeting. It's Take Your Daughter to Work Day. There was an official e-mail sent to everyone whose files indicated they had daughters between the ages of 14 and 16.
Leonard was named Leonard because his parents didn't want him to be put in advanced-placement classes. Howard is a beatbox. Penny is not into music.
Leonard's premise is flawed. In the original film, Rod Taylor got Yvette Mimieux with the time machine. In Back to the Future, Marty McFly got to hook up with his attractive young mother.
Penny and Sheldon are arguing about Sheldon's toy collection. Howard is trying to calm them down, but Sheldon doesn't want to listen to him.
Howard used Penny's loofah and exfoliated her brains out. Penny wants Howard to keep his stuffed-bear collection, but Howard wants to keep hers.
Penny invites Leonard to come in, but they need to talk first. Leonard made an 8 and sends it to Penny. They will talk later.
Sheldon wants Penny to send him comic books, anime, TV, film, D&D, manga, Greek, Roman, Norse gods, and any costume he wants.
Leonard will come in on Sunday. Sheldon is sick and has been producing sputum at an alarming rate since 2 a.m. Sheldon will see a doctor.
Leonard doesn't like Christy, but Penny lets her stay because she's family. Christy was engaged to Penny's cousin while sleeping with her brother. Sheldon apologizes for his earlier outburst.
Leonard and Penny both have people in their lives who want to nip intestinal polyps in the bud, so there's nothing new in the world of physics.
Penny and Sheldon are going to watch a costume parade. There will be prizes for the best costume, most frightening, most authentic and most accurate visualization of a scientific principle.
Penny and Howard don't like Christy. Christy is talking about every guy she slept with in Omaha and washing her thong collection in Penny's bathroom sink.
Leonard and Sheldon are going for a flight. Sheldon doesn't want to go with him, because he's afraid he'll embarrass Leonard. Sheldon is more suited to being the FAA analyst.
Penny will give Sheldon an enema. Sheldon's mom used to give him sponge baths, so Penny will take care of him like she used to.
Leonard has done a modification of minestrone for Lesley. He was going to characterize it as a modification with a neurochemical overlay, but he was thinking more of a biosocial exploration.
Sheldon would never use a transporter. The original Sheldon would have to be disintegrated in order to create a new Sheldon. The new Sheldon wouldn't be an improvement on the old Sheldon.
(KNOCKING)
Penny is on her way to perform in a one-night showcase production of Rent. Leonard has a symposium to go to. Penny and Howard will stand by Leonard.

Penny was invited to lunch by an Armenian family. She ate eight courses of lamb and they tried to fix her up with their son. By the time she got to work, they had given her shift away. Penny lost an entire day's pay.
The Szechuan Palace has been passing off orange chicken as tangerine chicken and Sheldon is going to confront them about it. Leonard would be more concerned about what they're passing off as chicken.
Penny got the latest copy of Applied Particle Physics Quarterly in her mailbox. Sheldon's mailbox didn't come to him, which is weird, because his came to him.
Leonard wants to know what's new at the Cheesecake Factory. Penny informs him that there's a chocolate key lime and a hallway friend, but there's nothing else new.
Leonard, Howard, Raj, Penny and Sheldon are going to play a game. Sheldon doesn't need a team, he could easily defeat them single-handedly, but the rules require four.
Leonard and Penny didn't anticipate something. Howard has come to call on Missy. Penny and Howard will meet with Missy later on.
Raj is at Leonard's birthday party. Everybody left an hour ago. Raj is on the phone with Leonard, telling him about a surprise.
Leonard shares with Penny another example from the field of Ebola research. Penny hugs him and sends him a link to another example. They are okay.
Leonard and Sheldon wonder who's going to tell his parents that they're not having grandchildren. Sheldon already has a dentist, so he doesn't have to tell them.
Leonard doesn't want to go to Sheldon's home. Sheldon is straightening up. When the transvestite lived here, Sheldon didn't care how he kept the place.
Sheldon had an internal blitzkrieg. Sheldon's mom had to fly back to Texas to help his dad, because the house had slipped off the cinder blocks again.
Leonard and Sheldon are arguing about the correct classification of things in the house. Sheldon has a compulsive need to sort and label the entire world around him.
Raj got him a limited-edition Dark Knight sculpture and an autographed copy of The Feynman Lectures on Physics. Penny got a sweater for his birthday.
Leonard is selling the Golden Age Flash to Larry at the comic-book store. Howard needs it to complete his Justice Society of America collection. Raj called dibs on it.
Lesley and Leonard will rehearse on Tuesdays at Leonard's place as their regular space is too hot. Leonard plays the cello. Leonard's name is Leonard.
Raj is late, because his hammer got stuck in the door on the bus. He is dressed as Thor. Leonard is angry, because Raj is an Indian god.
...a potential close friend and perhaps more. I don't wanna look like a dork.
...she knows she's been dated. Capital D. Heh. Bold face, underlined, like, dated. I think I might have a concussion. I'm gonna go lay down. Good night.
The Internet has been down for half an hour. Sheldon has never harmed a human being, except in cases where a human person's life would have been endangered.
Penny is an affectionate woman who likes to express her affection in nontraditional places such as elevators, parks, movie theaters and even in elevators.
Leonard is a little messy. Sheldon has hurt his fingers. The Mandelbrot set of complex numbers is a bit messy, too, because of Penny.
Leonard got served. Sheldon's imaginary girlfriend broke up with him. Howard has been there. Raj will grab a napkin and get served by Howard.

...so too I regret my participation in what was... ...at the very least, an error in judgment. The hallmark of the great human experiment... ...is the willingness to recognize one's mistakes. Madam Curie's discovery of radium turned out to have great potential... ...even though she would later die a slow, painful death from radiation poisoning.

Howard tried to watch "The Monkey and The Princess" online but they wanted his credit card. It's a children's story about an Indian princess who befriends a monkey. Sheldon's mother used to read it to him when he was sick.
Sheldon and Leonard were playing paintball. Sheldon was giving clear, concise orders. Penny hid behind a tree. She will clear a space on her calendar for an inquiry.
Leonard woke Sheldon up in the middle of a REM cycle. Sheldon doesn't want to talk to Leonard, so they will wait until the morning to talk.
Leonard will help Sheldon pull and turn at the corner, because gravity is a heatless bitch. Sheldon needs Leonard's formula for the corner.
Penny is going to Mike's. Leonard helped her to see it on her own and she's going to see him there. She's very grateful for that.
Sheldon wants Penny to sing 'Soft Kitty' to him. Penny doesn't know it, but Sheldon will teach her. She will sing it to her.
Sheldon and Howard were at the Topical Conference on Bose-Einstein Condensates parties. Leonard got a Nobel Prize and he doesn't know about other honors.
Penny didn't see Sheldon's present, because he didn't bring one. Sheldon doesn't like the idea of gift-giving. Sheldon would rather give $50 directly to Penny.
Howard has sent Missy a label but she hasn't received it yet. She will do it later on. (HUMMING).
Missy has lived her whole life dealing with the fact that her twin brother is Sheldon's twin brother. Sheldon always thought he was more like a cuckoo bird than a bird.
Lesley yelled at Sheldon and Leonard for eating at Big Boy. Sheldon will have the barbeque burger. Penny will have two burgers. Penny lives across the hall from Leonard and Sheldon.
Penny and Sheldon are going to meet. Sheldon will go with them. He will join them, too. He is excited... .
Sheldon and Girl in Butterfly Costume are drunk. They are watching 'MAMA'S ROOM' by GIANTS on SterEO.
Leonard will lie about going to a symposium in Pasadena and go to a drug intervention in Long Beach. Penny will operate as if the original lie is still in force.
Someone in Sichuan Province, China is using his computer to turn the lights on and off in Penny's and Leonard's house. Penny will see Leonard soon.
Leonard didn't like the look of the guy she was with. He was kind of dreamy. Sheldon and Howard think he looks better than him.
Leonard and Sheldon will take a break from the game. Sheldon needs his wrist brace as he's aggravating his old Nintendo injury. Penny will give the correct answers.
It worked. It really worked. They said I was mad, but it worked. Oh, no, not Morlocks. Not flesh-eating Morlocks.
Sheldon wants Penny to come with him to college. Sheldon was 11 when he first loved a woman. Penny doesn't know what a tie on the doorknob means.
Leonard and Sheldon are going to bring the elevator to her apartment. They don't have a dolly, lifting belts, or any measurable upper-body strength.
Howard, Leonard, Penny and Penny are going to meet. Penny should have brought her own car, but she didn't. She should've brought a suit.

Penny's last relationship with Koothrappali worked out well for him, he got a free iPod. Leonard might be different in a good way, he's the kind that gets into a relationship for a light-years. Penny's usual choices have not worked out so well.
Leonard is a hobbit, a Homo habilis discovering he has opposable thumbs. Kurt is mad at him for making him feel that way.
Raj needs to have a Lalita before his date with the Grasshopper. Penny doesn't want him to drink on the date, but he has to promise not to overdo it.
Sheldon wants to sleep with Missy because she has a superior genetic mutation and she has great potential. Missy doesn't understand why Sheldon is pimping her out for cheese.
Huh. Maybe I am her gay friend.
Sheldon (entering, wrapped in duvet)Leonard. Leonard. Leonard. Leonard, my comforter fell down and my sinuses hurt when I bend over. Leonard?
Gablehouser, Sheldon, Leonard, Raj and Raj are going to welcome Dennis Kim to their little family. Dennis Kim was the valedictorian at Stanford University.
Leonard and Sheldon are arguing about sex and 'Halo 3'. Sheldon is going to ask Howard to choose between "Halo" and "Sex".
Sheldon went from being Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart to Antonio Salieri today. Howard and Leonard advise him to eat and not insult his friends. Sheldon doesn't agree.
Sheldon wants to talk to his cat, but there is no one to hear him. He wants to sing to him. Sheldon is singing to her instead.

Mrs And we pray that you help Sheldon get back on his rocker. Now, after a moment of silent meditation, I'm gonna end with 'in Jesus' name'... ...but you two don't feel any obligation to join in. Unless, of course, the Holy Spirit moves you.
Leonard and Sheldon are asking Penny to be the fourth member of their 'Halo' team. Penny will join them. Sheldon is very happy about it.
Leonard will have seven seconds to get out of Sheldon's apartment. He will have to get on his hands and knees to get to the sensor close to Sheldon's room.
Leonard has been wearing the same clothes since the eighth grade. Penny wants him to put down the corduroy suit and wear something else. He refuses.
Leonard, Raj and Howard are looking for a girl to talk to. Leonard will talk to her. Raj will talk with her. Howard will talk about the kid.
Penny sends a message to Sheldon that it's Gravity Probe B. Sheldon doesn't want to answer because it's polite, but he has to let somebody else answer.
Howard got a ticket for launching a rocket in the park. He got it because he told the policewoman he had another rocket in his pants. He didn't recognize Dennis Kim.
Howard explains to Leonard and Raj how to pick up girls on VH1's "How to Pick up Girls". Raj has a problem speaking to women, because he lacks confidence.
Penny auditioned for Rent but she didn't get it and she couldn't figure out why. Sheldon has a conclusion based on an observation and experimentation.

Mrs Cooper wants Sheldon to apologize to his boss and get his job back. Sheldon is not going to do it. Mrs Cooper has been telling Sheldon since he was 4 that it's okay to be smarter than everybody, but you can't point it out.
Mrs Koothrappali has to go, because Doogie Howser is on. Raj and Howard don't believe it, because the show has been off the air for 20 years.
Shelly doesn't like company. Even as a little boy, he would send his imaginary friends home at the end of the day. Sheldon doesn't issue invitations to Missy's mother, but she's family.
Penny will take off all her clothes. Leonard and Sheldon will go to the junkyard and pick up 6 square meters of aluminum. Raj and Leonard will get the oxyacetylene torch.
Leonard has a genetically altered cat, Penny, but he doesn't want to have a relationship with her as the woman rejected him. Sheldon is trying to convince him to do so.
No one is pushing Leonard, Howard, Raj and Penny to hurry up. Raj has a job for the middle one. Penny is coming out of her apartment. Leonard and Sheldon are trying to time travel.
Leonard wants to knock Sheldon unconscious. Sheldon is upset about the past, but he doesn't want to change the present. Leonard's first clue was the late hour and the late night.
Sheldon assures Gablehouser that his research will go on uninterrupted. Howard, Leonard and Raj are surprised that he got a girl on his own. Smart is the new sexy.
Leonard and Sheldon turned the stereo down with their laptop. Penny turned it down with her laptop. San Francisco, Lisbon, Halifax and Halifax are the cities they visited.
Leonard and Sheldon are in a Chinese restaurant and they can't dance with her and her girlfriend, so they have to cut a dumpling in thirds to dance.
Howard was late for a meeting with Sheldon, Leonard and Rajesh. Sheldon is going to introduce them to Missy, who has already met Howard. She will introduce him.
Rajesh Koothrappali was in the hallway chatting with Penny. Penny was upset at first, probably because her sister shot somebody. Penny is still mad at Leonard.
Penny is going to take a shower. Leonard and Sheldon will make themselves comfortable and make themselves at home. Sheldon and Penny will watch a movie.
Sheldon wants to solve the Middle East crisis by building an exact replica of Jerusalem in the middle of the Mexican desert. The Jewish people will come to see it.
Leonard is an experimental physicist. He loves birthdays. He enjoyed waking up to Mom's special French-toast breakfast, playing laser tag with his friends and wearing the birthday king crown.
Leonard, Sheldon and Raj are going to push. Howard stepped outside to throw up. It's not a time-travel joke, it's a joke.
Raj, Leonard and Howard are going to play a game against Sheldon. Sheldon is Leonard's friend and Leonard's roommate, so he's not going to join them.
Penny's robe will be cleaned. Christy is in the shower. Penny's loofah mitt reaches places that Howard's doesn't reach.
Penny is buying the ingredients for very expensive urine. She will also buy some manganese and some other ingredients. Sheldon explains to Penny that the human body can only absorb so much urine.
Penny and Leonard are going to enter a couple of 'Halo' tournaments sometime. Penny and Leonard will just have a life. Penny is a sore loser.
Leonard designed the experiment that proved the hypothesis and he's going to the conference to present it. Sheldon doesn't want to give his word and wants the scientific community to believe him.
Leonard and Penny are going to have lunch at Quizno's for lunch. They will have a varied menu. Sheldon sometimes finds it filling and other times he doesn't.
Leslie and Sheldon are playing S.S. Sinking Ship. Sheldon will introduce the third-floor janitor, the lady from the lunch room and either her son or her butcher to his team.
Leonard was at a coffee klatch with a couple of friends and didn't meet the team. Sheldon is on the team, but he wasn't there. The winner of the Physics Bowl is the team that has the most fun.
Leonard understands Sheldon's career crisis. Sheldon is going to share the credit with Leonard, but Leonard doesn't want to share credit with Sheldon. Sheldon will go.
Penny and Sheldon are talking about Romulan singer who sang 'Oops!... I Did It Again' and the singer who did it again.
Raj is going to find new friends and rent Fiddler. Sheldon has a special edition of Fiddler in the special edition. It's catchy and has catchy tunes.
Sheldon's board has been touched. Leonard has sent a message to Sheldon about it. Sheldon is very upset about it, he is looking for Leonard.
Kandor was the capital city of the planet Krypton. It was miniaturized by Brainiac before Krypton exploded and rescued by Superman. Leonard will put on a shirt and sport coat.
Hey, Penny, when's your birthday?
Leonard had a colonoscopy and hasn't quite bounced back. She will still be expecting him. Sheldon will tell her that he had a routine colonoscopies.
Leonard has a question for Leslie, but he has to ask her in private. He sent a message to Howard and Leslie about it. Leslie will answer it.
Howard needs a band-aid to pretend he had epinephrine, but the hospital is not equipped to treat stupid people like him. The nurse will keep him under observation for an hour in the ER.
...have them fertilized and implanted in you. That way, everybody wins.
Leonard is at home. He will be back before the gorillas whip the crap out of Charlton Heston. Howard doesn't want Leonard to come back.
We had a dog who made a noise like that. Had to put him down.
Leonard is sick. Sheldon is wrapped in a duvet, but he is coughing and feeling sick. He is sending a message to Leonard via email.
Penny has carpal tunnel syndrome. She has a problem because Howard and Christy are having sex in her bedroom. She grew up on a farm, so she's not sure if it's a good idea.
Kurt, Sheldon and Penny are at Leonard's party. Leonard is having a good time, but it's getting late, so he can't join them.
Raj, Howard, Leonard and Leonard are going to play in the Physics Bowl. They need a team name. Howard suggests the Perpetual Motion Squad, which is beyond the laws of physics.
Leonard wants Penny to join him and Sheldon for Thai food and a Superman movie marathon. Penny likes the one where Lois Lane falls from the helicopter and Superman catches her.
Mrs Cooper and Leonard are trying to convince Sheldon to let him come to him. Sheldon is a physicist and should be doing research at the university doing research.
Leonard was walking through the park and saw children on a merry-go-round. Sheldon skipped over the part where he was thinking about the moment of inertia.
Penny wants to go out tonight, but Leonard and Sheldon don't know what "Out Tonight" is. They would hate it if cats could sing.
Sheldon's sandwich is an unmitigated disaster. He asked for turkey and roast beef with lettuce and Swiss on whole wheat. It's the right ingredients but in the wrong order. It was given to him.
Leonard wants to sell his share of the time machine for personal reasons. Raj will give him $100 and they will put it on his balcony. Howard will pay him 120 and put it in his garage.
A little bird told Raj and Leonard that Leonard is a magnificent beast. Leonard is not sure about that part, but it's true. The bird was a bird.
Howard won't look at anybody in the gifted program. If she agrees to go out with him, he will spend years doing her homework. He has allergies.

Leonard and Howard are online. Howard is about to send a signal from the laptop through their local ISP to San Francisco. The signal will be sent to a satellite in geosynchronous orbit to Lisbon, Portugal, where it will be handed off to transatlantic cables.
Leonard will drop Penny off at work yesterday. Penny will go up to the roof and hop over to the next building. She will use their stairwell.
Leonard will order a Grasshopper. Sheldon will have a virgin Cuba Libre. Penny will get a Diet Coke. She needs to practice mixing drinks.
Penny didn't know that Leslie had asked Leonard out. Leslie had turned him down. Penny might be offering consolation for Leslie's rejection. Sheldon and Leonard think Penny is adorable.
Leonard and Sheldon are going to present their paper on the properties of supersolids at the Topical Conference on Bose-Einstein Condensates at the Institute for Experimental Physics.
Penny, Sheldon, Howard, Leonard and All together are sending a message about the remote-control cars. The monster truck is out of Austin, Texas, the blue Viper is from suburban Tel Aviv.

Leonard and Sheldon are watching a group of people. They are discussing their interactions. Sheldon finds some patterns in the group's interactions. The newcomer approaches the existing group with the greeting, 'How wasted am I?' which is met with an approving chorus of 'Dude'.
Leonard and Sheldon will not speak to each other again, because Sheldon doesn't want to talk to Leonard again. Penny has heard it from Sheldon.
Sheldon, Howard, Leonard and Raj are going to buy cocktail shrimp for $800. They will take the dish off and put it in the elevator. The elevator is broken.
Sheldon and Raj don't want to be disembodied brains in jars in the future. Raj wants his brain in an android body. Howard wants to make sure he would still be Jewish.
Leonard and Sheldon are arguing. Sheldon came to the meeting because he knew Leonard would screw it up. Leonard has had enough of Sheldon's condescension and tells him off.
Howard and Raj will get the oxyacetylene torch. They will meet with Leonard and Penny in an hour to work on the place. Penny is satisfied with how it looks.
Penny's ex-boyfriend is disrupting the local gravity field. Sheldon and Leonard are leaving now, because they don't want to see him again.
Sheldon and Penny are going to participate in Penny's cousin Leopold's drug intervention on Friday night. The details are important to Sheldon and Leonard.
Well, maybe we are like Haroon and Tanvir.
Sheldon has a cousin Leopold, but he made him up. Leonard doesn't understand why he should tell her a different lie. Sheldon's lie is more transparent than Leonard's.
Raj doesn't want Sheldon to come to his place. Sheldon is curious and keeps asking questions. Raj doesn't like it. He doesn't accept it.
Penny and Sheldon had an intervention, but they weren't able to convince him to go to rehab. They convinced him to leave the motel and come say hello to Penny.
Sheldon and Penny are traveling forward at 51 miles an hour and weigh 4400 pounds. By the time they come to a stop, they will be occupying the same space as that Buick.
Penny (hugs him): LEONARD. Sheldon sends him a link to Leonard's email. It's from Penny. Sheldon checks it.
Leonard is going out with Penny. He's feeling nauseous, so he's going to talk to Sheldon. He made a grammatical mistake in his text.
Raj's waitress didn't take his order, but it will be reflected in his tip, because he was too neurotic to talk to her about it.
Penny feels violated. Leonard and Sheldon will talk about it later today, when Penny feels less violated. Sheldon is either a proctologist, or a general surgeon.
Leonard will have a CAT scan to look for a tumor on Sheldon's brain. Leonard can't wait to hear Sheldon sing again, because he enjoyed his last performance.
Leonard is going to sell his toy sword to Sheldon. He will talk to Raj and Sheldon about it after he puts down the box. Sheldon wants to block his path.
Penny and Sheldon agree that there will be no sponge baths and no enemas for Penny and Sheldon's daughter. They also don't want to have any enemases.
Sheldon feels uncomfortable about the fact that he lied. Penny is hungry and tired, so she doesn't know what to do about it. She's not a good liar.
Mrs Cooper made chicken. She hopes that it's not one of the animals that people think is magic. Sheldon gets his smoldering good looks from her chicken.
Leonard and Sheldon would have talked Leo into leaving the motel and coming home with them. Toby was abused in the Philippines by a Navy chaplain when he was 14.
Mrs Cooper will take her time with Sheldon. Sheldon's father, God rest his soul, used to say "Mary, you have to take your time". Sheldon once tried to fight a bobcat for some licorice.
Third Floor Janitor didn't answer the question. Gablehouser needs Sheldon's official answer to the question from AA. Sheldon is the team's leader.
Leonard is explaining to Penny that some animals are more evolved than others and some have climbed higher on the evolutionary tree. Kurt is unevolved, so he's a hobbit.
Gablehouser, Leonard and Sheldon will protest against the denial of a formal protest. The Velcro on Sheldon's wrist brace got caught on his shirt. The answer is technetium.
Mrs Cooper wants Sheldon to go to the office and apologize to his boss to get his job back. She also wants him to put on his fishing clothes.
Leonard is doing this to be a good neighbor. Sheldon is worried it will increase the odds of him having sexual congress with a woman, but Leonard claims it won't.
Raj doesn't see his friends. Lalita Gupta, who used to kick him in the samosas and call him untouchable, is now a dental student at USC.
Penny and Leonard are saying good night to each other. Penny told Raj that she could have said goodbye to her. Sheldon and Leonard think that she should have.
Howard rides a two-cylinder scooter with a basket in the front. He has to wear a helmet. Dr. Patel is a man from the exotic subcontinent of India.

The house had slipped off the cinder blocks again. It was tornado season. The housekeeper in the faculty residence didn't speak any English. When Sheldon convinced her that he was sick, she said, 'Möchtest du eine Darmspülung'.
Mrs Cooper wants to meet with Dr. Gablehouser, but he's busy. Sheldon will join them soon, because they're losing daylight.

...I just want to apologize. For some things that I have said. About you. I've been informed that you have feelings... ...and apparently, I have hurt them.

So if you are considering going into experimental physics... ...my door is always open. Again, I'm sorry that the demonstration didn't quite work out. Now we know what happens... ...when you accidentally spill peach Snapple into a helium-neon laser. The short answer is don't.

Anyway, in 1935, Erwin Schrödinger, in an attempt to explain... ...the Copenhagen interpretation of quantum physics, he proposed an experiment. A cat is placed in a box with a sealed vial of poison... ...that will break open at a random time. Now, since no one knows when or if the poison has been released... ...until the box is opened, the cat can be thought of as both alive and dead.
Leslie had to reduce the number of people going to the wedding and Howard didn't make the cut. He's a little uncomfortable about it.

Schnapps. You're right, that is fun.

The flags of Liechtenstein and Haiti were identical by coincidence. They competed against each other at the 1936 Olympics. Their embarrassment was overshadowed by rise of Fascism.

Good Lord, I could not have made this easier. A hydrogen atom, H, plus pigs minus P, 'higs.' Bow, General Zod trapped in the Phantom Zone... ...'bow-zone.' Pear, tickle, 'pear-tickle.' 'Higgs boson particle.' How could you not get that?

Okay, now you don't remind me of my mom.

Amy, Penny and Raj would have never met Stan Lee if it weren't for Sheldon. Bernadette wonders why Leonard, Howard and Raj didn't get an apartment together.

I do like that the ex-boyfriends out of the picture.

Penny, Leonard, Sheldon and Amy are convinced that they are real. Sheldon wants to know if Las Vegas was on Las Vegas' side at any point.
Sheldon, Penny, Howard, Ferrigno, Bana, Norton and Ruffalo were going to go as the Hulk. They spent a lot of time on their costumes.

Sheldon and Amy haven't broken up. Amy pointed out that Leonard and Penny are trying to manipulate Sheldon. Sheldon and Amy are still together and stronger than ever.

Good night.

What do you say let's go have some fun? My wife's in New York, and I got a Lion King residual check burning a hole in my pocket.

Amy has sent Sheldon a message. Sheldon likes it very much. He likes it a great deal... . ... .)..
Stuart wants Howard and Bernadette to go home. She's fed, she took her pills, she's all tucked in and she's watching TV.

Oh, look at little Laura Ingalls, eating that peanut butter sandwich. Peanut butter? Huh... That's strange, since peanut butter wasn't introduced until the early 1900s. If I knew this show was about time travel, I would have watched it much sooner.

Mrs Davis's husband left her, but she doesn't feel unattractive. Raj tells her that penguins get cheated on, and they're adorable.

Leonard is in. Penny and Leonard are going to get engaged. They are planning to get married in the near future. They will have a baby together.

Leonard, Amy, Bernadette and Howie are going to spend the night at Howie's mom's tonight. Stuart is sick. Penny and Raj will call 911.

Howard was seeing another woman. Sheldon won't be seeing Amy any more. Leonard will be there when Sheldon tells Amy that and he will deduct any extra time they spend together at work from their weekly quota.

Howard and Sheldon are going to talk about Sheldon's mother's rape. Sheldon is drunk and doesn't know what it's like to see his mother ravaging someone.

Leonard, Penny, Stuart and Raj are going to meet for dinner and have dinner like they always do. They will see each other in 20 years.
Penny and Leonard have seen things. Sheldon has seen things, too, but he doesn't want to talk about it. Amy's phone is ringing.

Leonard got his daughter to watch a six-part documentary on Monty Python. He's proud of it and is proud of her watching it.
Leonard, Zack and Howard are sorry about what happened. Zack was a terrible husband and a terrible son-in-law, because he was never around.

Penny didn't get the part in the horror movie she passed on, but she might be offered another one soon. She doesn't know what to do.

so what do you know?

Raj suggests Amy should not pressure him to accept intimacy on her terms. Amy should go to see him instead of pressuring him on his terms.

Howard is taking Sheldon on a romantic getaway for the weekend. Bernadette is the reason he's doing it. Sheldon is not coming out until he sees proof you don't have an air freshener in your car.
Sheldon's spirit guides are telling him that Amy is the key to his happiness. He should give himself to this relationship and all his other pursuits will come into focus once he does.
Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj are not going to WonderCon in Anaheim. The only T-shirts they have left are small and XXXXL.

Leonard used to stick a coat hanger down there when he broke his arm. Sheldon and Sheldon have unresolved issues that they need to work on.

Penny and Sheldon are sad about WonderCon in Anaheim, but there's always WonderCon at Anaheim, which is just as good as it was in Anaheim.
Howard is learning how to be a man in a culture where it's increasingly difficult to know how. He's copying Leonard. He shouldn't have done it and it makes him feel sad.
Penny and Leonard are discussing Sheldon's relationship with Amy. Sheldon embarrassed Amy, but Penny didn't hear the details. Leonard is very upset about it.

Leonard is having a good time at a party, but his pants are buzzing. Penny sends a message to everybody to say "Hi" to Leonard.
Penny needs to start making some smart decisions with her career and her life. She doesn't know what to do. Leonard will not buy anything for her.
